newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai's Pudong fixed asset investment soars.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai's Pudong fixed asset investment soars.

text.p: Investment in fixed assets in Shanghai's Pudong New Area reached 17.989 billion yuan ($2.17 billion) in the January-July period of 1997, up a year-on-year 45 percent, the Business News said on Monday.
Pudong, located across the Huangpu River from the city centre, is Shanghai's premier development zone.
Investment in infrastructure was 6.713 billion yuan in the first seven months, a massive increase of 170 percent from the same period last year, the newspaper said.
Investment in secondary industry has also registered solid growth, with the value reaching 4.8 billion yuan in the first seven months of 1997, up 48.6 percent from the year-ago period, it said.
